physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Self-mutilation behaviors noted; a large thoracolumbar myelomeningocele with midline hirsutism; hydrocephalus with ventriculoperitoneal shunt; left pelvic kidney and duplicated right collecting system; Grade IV ureteral reflux; neurogenic bladder.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially, the patient developed severe radicular pain and self-mutilation behaviors at age 12. After detethering procedures, the radicular chest and back pain resolved and self-mutilation ceased. However, two years later, severe radicular pain recurred and self-mutilation behaviors resumed before resolving again post second detethering procedure. One year after the second procedure, the patient remained without symptoms.
